In this table, you can see how tenses change between direct speech and indirect speech. We haven't learned all of these tenses yet, but don't worry. For now, we'll focus on the tenses that we know.
We can use the word "that" when we use indirect speech. In this context, it is a conjunction.

Employers interview various candidates before choosing the best and offering them the job. When talking about a job vacancy you will also hear the terms position and role. Have a look at the sentences below.
CV
CV
Jamie accepted the [k]job offer[/k].
We offered him the job. He was definitely the [k]best[/k] candidate.
Annette is quite impatient. However, she is [h]flexible[/h] and [h]driven[/h].

"Before getting a job you usually have an interview. In this unit, we’ll learn some useful phrases that you might hear or say in a job interview. First impression is important! You might make a good impression, but you might make a bad impression."
[k]You[/k] [k]told[/k] [k]me[/k] [k]that[/k] [k]the interview[/k] [k]went[/k] [k]quite well.[/k]

look

Next, we’ll look at some questions that you sometimes hear in an interview. If you want to practise, you can try answering each question before going to the next screen.
Eric...
[k]You[/k] [k]said[/k] [k]that[/k] [k]he[/k] [k]made[/k] [k]a good impression[/k] [k]in the interview.[/k]
No, I need to [k]update[/k] my CV first, and I have to [k]apply[/k] before midnight tonight, otherwise it's too late.
What would you say are your strengths, and what are your [k]weaknesses[/k]?
[k]I[/k] [k]am[/k] [k]going[/k] [k]to[/k] [k]update[/k] [k]my[/k] [k]CV[/k] [k]today[/k].

You will often hear expressions like job hunting, job seeking or job searching, which all mean "trying to find a job" and are all interchangeable. We can use them both as nouns and as verbs. Have a look at the examples below.
What should you update before sending an application? Click on the words.
They should offer him the job, he has a great CV and did well in the interview.
Yeah, I hope so, that would be amazing!
experience
Past continuous
their application.
Nick: Emma told me I'd got the job!
So what makes a good candidate? Usually it is his/her skills, qualifications and experience. We can also say that someone is a good / bad fit for a position.
[k]She[/k] [k]said[/k] [k]he[/k] [k]was[/k] [k]a great fit[/k] [k]for the role.[/k]
That would be great, thank you. So, Eric, why do you think you are the right [k]candidate[/k] for this role?
impression
strength

I found my current job after months of job hunting. After updating my CV, I found an advert online and sent an application. My skills and experience suited the role perfectly, and I think I made a good impression at the interview, because I was offered the job on the same day.
Noun: I have an interview tomorrow at 10 a.m.

We often use verbs like "to say" and "to tell" to introduce indirect speech. This is called the reporting verb. With the verb "to tell" we need an indirect object.
This sentence contains indirect speech.
Verb in indirect speech
Patience is Eric’s strength.
Nina [h]sent[/h] [h]an[/h] [h]application[/h] to the UN, she wants to work there as an interpreter.

Before applying Sonia needs to...

When we use indirect speech, we often change parts of the sentence. Personal pronouns and verb conjugations often need to change. 

Did you notice? If the reporting verb is in a past tense, we sometimes change the tense in the indirect speech as well. This is not obligatory, but it's useful to know. We'll learn how the tense changes on the following screens.

When we want to tell someone about a previous conversation, there are two ways to do this: using direct or indirect speech. In direct speech (example 1), we give the exact words. Indirect speech (example 2) focuses more on the content, not on the exact words.
Simon doesn't think she would be a good fit for the position.
add information to her CV.
worst
Yes, she told me! I really think they will [k]offer[/k] her the job, she has a great resume!
Simon doesn't think she is a [k]good[/k] [k]fit[/k] for the position.
Verb in direct speech

At the end of the job hunting process, probably after an interview, you will receive a job offer if you are successful. We also use the phrase to offer someone the job. You can either accept or decline a job offer.

True or false?

These days, people mainly look for jobs online, on job websites. On these websites, you can find job adverts and apply for jobs. Usually you will send your CV and a cover letter. In American English, a CV is usually called a resume. A resume or CV is a short description of your qualifications and experience.
Nina has had a job offer.
